toolUseResult.originalFile:
.DEFAULT_GOAL := help

.PHONY: help install lint format format-check complexity cpd pylint test test-e2e allure-report check

help: ## Show available targets
	@grep -E '^[a-zA-Z_-]+:.*?## .*$$' $(MAKEFILE_LIST) | awk 'BEGIN {FS = ":.*?## "}; {printf "  %-15s %s\n", $$1, $$2}'

install: ## Install dependencies
	uv sync

lint: ## Run linter
	uvx ruff check src tests

format: ## Auto-format code
	uvx black src tests

format-check: ## Check formatting without changing files
	uvx black --check src tests

complexity: ## Check cyclomatic complexity (all functions must be grade B or better)
	uvx radon cc src -a -nc

cpd: ## Check for copy-pasted code (5+ similar lines)
	@output=$$(uvx --from pylint symilar -d 5 --ignore-imports --ignore-docstrings --ignore-signatures $$(find src -name "*.py")); \
	echo "$$output" | tail -1; \
	echo "$$output" | tail -1 | grep -q "duplicates=0 " || { echo "$$output"; exit 1; }

pylint: ## Run pylint checks
	uvx --from pylint pylint src/lws --recursive=y

test: ## Run test suite (excludes e2e)
	uv run pytest --ignore=tests/e2e --alluredir=allure-results/unit

test-e2e: ## Run e2e tests (no Docker required)
	uv run pytest tests/e2e/ -v --alluredir=allure-results/e2e

allure-report: ## Generate and open Allure HTML report (requires allure CLI)
	allure generate allure-results -o allure-report --clean
	allure open allure-report

check: lint format-check complexity cpd pylint test ## Run all checks (what CI runs)

lines: test-e2e: ## Run e2e tests (no Docker required)
+  uv run pytest tests/e2e/ -v -p no:allure_pytest -p allure_pytest_bdd --alluredir=allure-results/e2e
allure-report: ## Generate and open Allure HTML report (requires allure CLI)

    "croniter>=2.0.0",
    "rich>=13.0.0",
    "python-multipart>=0.0.9",
    "pyjwt[crypto]>=2.8.0",
    "httpx>=0.27.0",
    "docker>=7.0.0",
]

[project.urls]
Homepage = "https://local-web-services.github.io/www"
Repository = "https://github.com/local-web-services/local-web-services"
Issues = "https://github.com/local-web-services/local-web-services/issues"

[project.scripts]
ldk = "lws.cli.ldk:app"
lws = "lws.cli.lws:app"

[build-system]
requires = ["hatchling"]
build-backend = "hatchling.build"

[tool.hatch.build.targets.wheel]
packages = ["src/lws"]

[tool.pytest.ini_options]
testpaths = ["tests"]
asyncio_mode = "auto"
addopts = "-p no:allure_pytest_bdd"

[dependency-groups]
dev = [
    "httpx>=0.28.1",
    "pytest>=9.0.2",
    "pytest-asyncio>=1.3.0",
    "pytest-bdd>=8.1.0",
    "allure-pytest-bdd>=2.13.0",
    "black>=24.0.0",
    "ruff>=0.4.0",
    "radon>=6.0.0",
]

[project.optional-dependencies]
dev = [
    "pytest>=8.0.0",
    "pytest-asyncio>=0.23.0",
    "pytest-bdd>=8.1.0",
    "allure-pytest>=2.13.0",
    "allure-pytest-bdd>=2.13.0",
    "httpx>=0.27.0",
    "black>=24.0.0",
    "ruff>=0.4.0",
    "radon>=6.0.0",
]

[tool.black]
line-length = 100
target-version = ["py311"]

[tool.ruff]
line-length = 100
target-version = "py311"

[tool.ruff.lint]
select = ["E", "F", "I", "W", "UP", "C90"]

[tool.ruff.lint.isort]
known-first-party = ["lws"]

[tool.ruff.lint.per-file-ignores]
"src/lws/api/gui.py" = ["E501"]

[tool.ruff.lint.mccabe]
max-complexity = 10

[tool.pylint.main]
load-plugins = []

[tool.pylint."messages control"]
disable = [
    "E0401",   # import-error — false positive under uvx (no venv)
    "W0718",   # broad-exception-caught — suppressed globally per user decision
    "R0801",   # duplicate-code — handled by `make cpd`
    "C0301",   # line-too-long — handled by ruff/black
    "C0302",   # too-many-lines — handled by ruff
    "C0114",   # missing-module-docstring — not enforced in this project
    "C0115",   # missing-class-docstring — not enforced in this project
    "R0903",   # too-few-public-methods — dataclass/protocol pattern
    "R0902",   # too-many-instance-attributes — config objects
    "R0913",   # too-many-arguments — structural
    "R0917",   # too-many-positional-arguments — structural
    "R0904",   # too-many-public-methods — provider pattern
    "R0911",   # too-many-return-statements — structural
    "R0914",   # too-many-locals — structural
    "C0103",   # invalid-name — naming conventions differ from pylint defaults
    "W0603",   # global-statement — used sparingly, intentional
    "W0621",   # redefined-outer-name — rare, intentional
]

content.text: Revert the `addopts` change since we don't need plugin swapping anymore. Disable allure for non-e2e tests to avoid overhead.

content.text: Simplify the Makefile — unit tests don't use allure, e2e tests do.

input.content:
.DEFAULT_GOAL := help

.PHONY: help install lint format format-check complexity cpd pylint test test-e2e allure-report check

help: ## Show available targets
	@grep -E '^[a-zA-Z_-]+:.*?## .*$$' $(MAKEFILE_LIST) | awk 'BEGIN {FS = ":.*?## "}; {printf "  %-15s %s\n", $$1, $$2}'

install: ## Install dependencies
	uv sync

lint: ## Run linter
	uvx ruff check src tests

format: ## Auto-format code
	uvx black src tests

format-check: ## Check formatting without changing files
	uvx black --check src tests

complexity: ## Check cyclomatic complexity (all functions must be grade B or better)
	uvx radon cc src -a -nc

cpd: ## Check for copy-pasted code (5+ similar lines)
	@output=$$(uvx --from pylint symilar -d 5 --ignore-imports --ignore-docstrings --ignore-signatures $$(find src -name "*.py")); \
	echo "$$output" | tail -1; \
	echo "$$output" | tail -1 | grep -q "duplicates=0 " || { echo "$$output"; exit 1; }

pylint: ## Run pylint checks
	uvx --from pylint pylint src/lws --recursive=y

test: ## Run test suite (excludes e2e)
	uv run pytest --ignore=tests/e2e

test-e2e: ## Run e2e tests (no Docker required)
	uv run pytest tests/e2e/ -v --alluredir=allure-results

allure-report: ## Generate and open Allure HTML report (requires allure CLI)
	allure generate allure-results -o allure-report --clean
	allure open allure-report

check: lint format-check complexity cpd pylint test ## Run all checks (what CI runs)

content.text: Simplify the CI workflow to only collect allure from e2e.

input.content:
name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:

jobs:
  lint:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make lint
      - run: make format-check

  analysis:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make complexity
      - run: make cpd
      - run: make pylint

  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make test

  test-e2e:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make test-e2e
      - uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        if: always()
        with:
          name: allure-results
          path: allure-results
          retention-days: 5

  allure-report:
    if: always()
    needs: [test-e2e]
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      contents: read
      actions: read
      checks: write
      pull-requests: write
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: allure-results
          path: allure-results
        continue-on-error: true

      - name: Generate Allure report
        uses: simple-elf/allure-report-action@v1.12
        if: always()
        with:
          allure_results: allure-results
          allure_report: allure-report
          allure_history: allure-history
          keep_reports: 20

      - name: Publish Allure report to GitHub Pages
        if: always() && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main'
        uses: peaceiris/actions-gh-pages@v4
        with:
          github_token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          publish_branch: gh-pages
          publish_dir: allure-history

      - name: Post Allure report link on PR
        if: always() && github.event_name == 'pull_request'
        uses: actions/github-script@v7
        with:
          script: |
            const fs = require('fs');

            // Count results
            let total = 0, passed = 0, failed = 0, broken = 0;
            const resultsDir = 'allure-results';
            if (fs.existsSync(resultsDir)) {
              const files = fs.readdirSync(resultsDir).filter(f => f.endsWith('-result.json'));
              for (const file of files) {
                try {
                  const data = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(`${resultsDir}/${file}`, 'utf8'));
                  total++;
                  if (data.status === 'passed') passed++;
                  else if (data.status === 'failed') failed++;
                  else if (data.status === 'broken') broken++;
                } catch (e) {}
              }
            }

            const status = failed + broken > 0 ? '❌' : '✅';
            const body = [
              `## ${status} Allure Test Report`,
              '',
              `| Total | Passed | Failed | Broken |`,
              `|-------|--------|--------|--------|`,
              `| ${total} | ${passed} | ${failed} | ${broken} |`,
              '',
              `> Full report is published to GitHub Pages on merge to main.`,
            ].join('\n');

            // Find existing comment to update
            const { data: comments } = await github.rest.issues.listComments({
              owner: context.repo.owner,
              repo: context.repo.repo,
              issue_number: context.issue.number,
            });
            const existing = comments.find(c =>
              c.user.type === 'Bot' && c.body.includes('Allure Test Report')
            );

            if (existing) {
              await github.rest.issues.updateComment({
                owner: context.repo.owner,
                repo: context.repo.repo,
                comment_id: existing.id,
                body,
              });
            } else {
              await github.rest.issues.createComment({
                owner: context.repo.owner,
                repo: context.repo.repo,
                issue_number: context.issue.number,
                body,
              });
            }

toolUseResult.content:
name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:

jobs:
  lint:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make lint
      - run: make format-check

  analysis:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make complexity
      - run: make cpd
      - run: make pylint

  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make test

  test-e2e:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make test-e2e
      - uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        if: always()
        with:
          name: allure-results
          path: allure-results
          retention-days: 5

  allure-report:
    if: always()
    needs: [test-e2e]
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      contents: read
      actions: read
      checks: write
      pull-requests: write
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: allure-results
          path: allure-results
        continue-on-error: true

      - name: Generate Allure report
        uses: simple-elf/allure-report-action@v1.12
        if: always()
        with:
          allure_results: allure-results
          allure_report: allure-report
          allure_history: allure-history
          keep_reports: 20

      - name: Publish Allure report to GitHub Pages
        if: always() && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main'
        uses: peaceiris/actions-gh-pages@v4
        with:
          github_token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          publish_branch: gh-pages
          publish_dir: allure-history

      - name: Post Allure report link on PR
        if: always() && github.event_name == 'pull_request'
        uses: actions/github-script@v7
        with:
          script: |
            const fs = require('fs');

            // Count results
            let total = 0, passed = 0, failed = 0, broken = 0;
            const resultsDir = 'allure-results';
            if (fs.existsSync(resultsDir)) {
              const files = fs.readdirSync(resultsDir).filter(f => f.endsWith('-result.json'));
              for (const file of files) {
                try {
                  const data = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(`${resultsDir}/${file}`, 'utf8'));
                  total++;
                  if (data.status === 'passed') passed++;
                  else if (data.status === 'failed') failed++;
                  else if (data.status === 'broken') broken++;
                } catch (e) {}
              }
            }

            const status = failed + broken > 0 ? '❌' : '✅';
            const body = [
              `## ${status} Allure Test Report`,
              '',
              `| Total | Passed | Failed | Broken |`,
              `|-------|--------|--------|--------|`,
              `| ${total} | ${passed} | ${failed} | ${broken} |`,
              '',
              `> Full report is published to GitHub Pages on merge to main.`,
            ].join('\n');

            // Find existing comment to update
            const { data: comments } = await github.rest.issues.listComments({
              owner: context.repo.owner,
              repo: context.repo.repo,
              issue_number: context.issue.number,
            });
            const existing = comments.find(c =>
              c.user.type === 'Bot' && c.body.includes('Allure Test Report')
            );

            if (existing) {
              await github.rest.issues.updateComment({
                owner: context.repo.owner,
                repo: context.repo.repo,
                comment_id: existing.id,
                body,
              });
            } else {
              await github.rest.issues.createComment({
                owner: context.repo.owner,
                repo: context.repo.repo,
                issue_number: context.issue.number,
                body,
              });
            }

toolUseResult.originalFile:
name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:

jobs:
  lint:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make lint
      - run: make format-check

  analysis:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make complexity
      - run: make cpd
      - run: make pylint

  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make test
      - uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        if: always()
        with:
          name: allure-results-unit
          path: allure-results/unit
          retention-days: 5

  test-e2e:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make test-e2e
      - uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        if: always()
        with:
          name: allure-results-e2e
          path: allure-results/e2e
          retention-days: 5

  allure-report:
    if: always()
    needs: [test, test-e2e]
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      contents: read
      actions: read
      checks: write
      pull-requests: write
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: allure-results-unit
          path: allure-results/unit
        continue-on-error: true

      - uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: allure-results-e2e
          path: allure-results/e2e
        continue-on-error: true

      # Merge all results into a single directory
      - name: Merge Allure results
        run: |
          mkdir -p allure-results-merged
          cp -r allure-results/unit/* allure-results-merged/ 2>/dev/null || true
          cp -r allure-results/e2e/* allure-results-merged/ 2>/dev/null || true

      - name: Generate Allure report
        uses: simple-elf/allure-report-action@v1.12
        if: always()
        with:
          allure_results: allure-results-merged
          allure_report: allure-report
          allure_history: allure-history
          keep_reports: 20

      - name: Publish Allure report to GitHub Pages
        if: always() && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main'
        uses: peaceiris/actions-gh-pages@v4
        with:
          github_token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          publish_branch: gh-pages
          publish_dir: allure-history

      - name: Post Allure report link on PR
        if: always() && github.event_name == 'pull_request'
        uses: actions/github-script@v7
        with:
          script: |
            const fs = require('fs');

            // Count results
            let total = 0, passed = 0, failed = 0, broken = 0;
            const resultsDir = 'allure-results-merged';
            if (fs.existsSync(resultsDir)) {
              const files = fs.readdirSync(resultsDir).filter(f => f.endsWith('-result.json'));
              for (const file of files) {
                try {
                  const data = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(`${resultsDir}/${file}`, 'utf8'));
                  total++;
                  if (data.status === 'passed') passed++;
                  else if (data.status === 'failed') failed++;
                  else if (data.status === 'broken') broken++;
                } catch (e) {}
              }
            }

            const status = failed + broken > 0 ? '❌' : '✅';
            const body = [
              `## ${status} Allure Test Report`,
              '',
              `| Total | Passed | Failed | Broken |`,
              `|-------|--------|--------|--------|`,
              `| ${total} | ${passed} | ${failed} | ${broken} |`,
              '',
              `> Full report is published to GitHub Pages on merge to main.`,
            ].join('\n');

            // Find existing comment to update
            const { data: comments } = await github.rest.issues.listComments({
              owner: context.repo.owner,
              repo: context.repo.repo,
              issue_number: context.issue.number,
            });
            const existing = comments.find(c =>
              c.user.type === 'Bot' && c.body.includes('Allure Test Report')
            );

            if (existing) {
              await github.rest.issues.updateComment({
                owner: context.repo.owner,
                repo: context.repo.repo,
                comment_id: existing.id,
                body,
              });
            } else {
              await github.rest.issues.createComment({
                owner: context.repo.owner,
                repo: context.repo.repo,
                issue_number: context.issue.number,
                body,
              });
            }

content.text:
All passing:
- `make check`: **2240 passed**
- `make test-e2e`: **226 passed**, 227 allure result files generated

Here's a summary of everything done:

**Steps migration:**
- Merged step definitions from `steps/*.py` into `conftest.py` for all 20 services
- Deleted all `steps/` directories
- Removed 4 architecture tests enforcing the steps/ pattern
- Removed the steps/ exemption from `test_file_naming.py`
- Updated `END_TO_END.md` documentation

**Allure Report integration:**
- Added `allure-pytest-bdd` dependency for BDD e2e tests
- `make test-e2e` now writes Allure results to `allure-results/`
- `make allure-report` generates and opens the HTML report locally
- Added `allure-results` and `allure-report` to `.gitignore`
- Updated `.github/workflows/ci.yml` with:
  - `test-e2e` job uploads allure results as an artifact
  - New `allure-report` job generates the report, publishes to GitHub Pages on main, and posts a summary comment with pass/fail counts on PRs

git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
Migrate E2E tests to Gherkin/pytest-bdd with Allure reporting

- Convert all 20 E2E services from class-based tests to Gherkin feature
  files with pytest-bdd step definitions in conftest.py
- Remove one-file-per-step pattern (steps/ directories) in favor of
  defining steps directly in each service's conftest.py
- Add allure-pytest-bdd for BDD test reporting
- Add GitHub Actions workflow to generate Allure reports on PRs
- Update architecture tests and documentation to match new patterns

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

input.command:
gh pr create --title "Migrate E2E tests to Gherkin/pytest-bdd with Allure reporting" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary

- Convert all 20 E2E services from class-based tests to Gherkin feature files with pytest-bdd step definitions in `conftest.py`
- Remove one-file-per-step pattern (`steps/` directories) — steps now live directly in each service's `conftest.py`
- Add `allure-pytest-bdd` for BDD test reporting with Allure
- Add GitHub Actions workflow job to generate Allure reports and post summary on PRs
- Update architecture tests and documentation to match new patterns

## Test plan

- [ ] `make check` passes (2240 unit/integration/architecture tests)
- [ ] `make test-e2e` passes (226 BDD scenarios across 20 services)
- [ ] Allure results are generated in `allure-results/`
- [ ] CI `allure-report` job posts summary comment on this PR

🤖 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)
EOF
)"

input.content:
name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:

jobs:
  lint:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make lint
      - run: make format-check

  analysis:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make complexity
      - run: make cpd
      - run: make pylint

  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make test

  test-e2e:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make test-e2e
      - uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        if: always()
        with:
          name: allure-results
          path: allure-results
          retention-days: 5

  allure-report:
    if: always()
    needs: [test-e2e]
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      contents: write
      actions: read
      checks: write
      pull-requests: write
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: allure-results
          path: allure-results
        continue-on-error: true

      - name: Get Allure history from gh-pages
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        if: always()
        continue-on-error: true
        with:
          ref: gh-pages
          path: gh-pages

      - name: Copy Allure history
        run: |
          mkdir -p allure-results/history
          cp -r gh-pages/history/* allure-results/history/ 2>/dev/null || true

      - name: Install Allure CLI
        run: |
          curl -sL https://github.com/allure-framework/allure2/releases/download/2.32.0/allure-2.32.0.tgz | tar xz
          echo "$PWD/allure-2.32.0/bin" >> $GITHUB_PATH

      - name: Generate Allure report
        if: always()
        run: allure generate allure-results -o allure-report --clean

      - name: Publish Allure report to GitHub Pages
        if: always() && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main'
        uses: peaceiris/actions-gh-pages@v4
        with:
          github_token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          publish_branch: gh-pages
          publish_dir: allure-report
          keep_files: false

      - name: Post Allure report summary on PR
        if: always() && github.event_name == 'pull_request'
        uses: actions/github-script@v7
        with:
          script: |
            const fs = require('fs');

            let total = 0, passed = 0, failed = 0, broken = 0;
            const resultsDir = 'allure-results';
            if (fs.existsSync(resultsDir)) {
              const files = fs.readdirSync(resultsDir).filter(f => f.endsWith('-result.json'));
              for (const file of files) {
                try {
                  const data = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(`${resultsDir}/${file}`, 'utf8'));
                  total++;
                  if (data.status === 'passed') passed++;
                  else if (data.status === 'failed') failed++;
                  else if (data.status === 'broken') broken++;
                } catch (e) {}
              }
            }

            const status = failed + broken > 0 ? '❌' : '✅';
            const body = [
              `## ${status} Allure Test Report`,
              '',
              `| Total | Passed | Failed | Broken |`,
              `|-------|--------|--------|--------|`,
              `| ${total} | ${passed} | ${failed} | ${broken} |`,
              '',
              `> Full report is published to GitHub Pages on merge to main.`,
            ].join('\n');

            const { data: comments } = await github.rest.issues.listComments({
              owner: context.repo.owner,
              repo: context.repo.repo,
              issue_number: context.issue.number,
            });
            const existing = comments.find(c =>
              c.user.type === 'Bot' && c.body.includes('Allure Test Report')
            );

            if (existing) {
              await github.rest.issues.updateComment({
                owner: context.repo.owner,
                repo: context.repo.repo,
                comment_id: existing.id,
                body,
              });
            } else {
              await github.rest.issues.createComment({
                owner: context.repo.owner,
                repo: context.repo.repo,
                issue_number: context.issue.number,
                body,
              });
            }

      - uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4

    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      contents: write
      actions: read
      checks: write
      pull-requests: write

toolUseResult.originalFile:
name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:

jobs:
  lint:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make lint
      - run: make format-check

  analysis:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make complexity
      - run: make cpd
      - run: make pylint

  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make test

  test-e2e:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make test-e2e
      - uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        if: always()
        with:
          name: allure-results
          path: allure-results
          retention-days: 5

  allure-report:
    if: always()
    needs: [test-e2e]
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      contents: read
      actions: read
      checks: write
      pull-requests: write
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: allure-results
          path: allure-results
        continue-on-error: true

      - name: Generate Allure report
        uses: simple-elf/allure-report-action@v1.12
        if: always()
        with:
          allure_results: allure-results
          allure_report: allure-report
          allure_history: allure-history
          keep_reports: 20

      - name: Publish Allure report to GitHub Pages
        if: always() && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main'
        uses: peaceiris/actions-gh-pages@v4
        with:
          github_token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          publish_branch: gh-pages
          publish_dir: allure-history

      - name: Post Allure report link on PR
        if: always() && github.event_name == 'pull_request'
        uses: actions/github-script@v7
        with:
          script: |
            const fs = require('fs');

            // Count results
            let total = 0, passed = 0, failed = 0, broken = 0;
            const resultsDir = 'allure-results';
            if (fs.existsSync(resultsDir)) {
              const files = fs.readdirSync(resultsDir).filter(f => f.endsWith('-result.json'));
              for (const file of files) {
                try {
                  const data = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(`${resultsDir}/${file}`, 'utf8'));
                  total++;
                  if (data.status === 'passed') passed++;
                  else if (data.status === 'failed') failed++;
                  else if (data.status === 'broken') broken++;
                } catch (e) {}
              }
            }

            const status = failed + broken > 0 ? '❌' : '✅';
            const body = [
              `## ${status} Allure Test Report`,
              '',
              `| Total | Passed | Failed | Broken |`,
              `|-------|--------|--------|--------|`,
              `| ${total} | ${passed} | ${failed} | ${broken} |`,
              '',
              `> Full report is published to GitHub Pages on merge to main.`,
            ].join('\n');

            // Find existing comment to update
            const { data: comments } = await github.rest.issues.listComments({
              owner: context.repo.owner,
              repo: context.repo.repo,
              issue_number: context.issue.number,
            });
            const existing = comments.find(c =>
              c.user.type === 'Bot' && c.body.includes('Allure Test Report')
            );

            if (existing) {
              await github.rest.issues.updateComment({
                owner: context.repo.owner,
                repo: context.repo.repo,
                comment_id: existing.id,
                body,
              });
            } else {
              await github.rest.issues.createComment({
                owner: context.repo.owner,
                repo: context.repo.repo,
                issue_number: context.issue.number,
                body,
              });
            }

input.command:
git add .github/workflows/ci.yml && git commit -m "$(cat <<'EOF'
Fix allure-report CI job: install Allure CLI directly

The simple-elf/allure-report-action uses a deprecated openjdk:8-jre-alpine
Docker image. Install the Allure CLI tarball directly instead.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.6 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)"

input.prompt: Extract the complete GitHub Actions workflow configuration for Allure Report integration. I need the exact YAML configuration, action names, versions, and all parameters. Focus on the recommended setup for generating and publishing reports.

content.content:
# Allure Report GitHub Actions Workflow Configuration

Based on the documentation, here's the complete workflow setup:

## Minimal Working Example

```yaml
name: Tests with Allure Report

on:
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]

permissions:
  pull-requests: write
  checks: write

jobs:
  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: "20"

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci

      - name: Run tests and generate report
        run: npx allure run -- npm run test

      - name: Run Allure Action
        uses: allure-framework/allure-report@v0
        with:
          report-directory: "./allure-report"
          github-token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
```

## Key Configuration Parameters

The action accepts two primary inputs:

- **`report-directory`**: "Path to the generated report directory. By default, it's set to `./allure-report`"
- **`github-token`**: "GitHub Token that's used for posting the comments in Pull Requests"

## Required Permissions

```yaml
permissions:
  pull-requests: write
  checks: write
```

These enable PR comments and GitHub Checks for quality gate results.

## Additional Features

The action automatically posts a summary table to PRs and creates a GitHub Check if quality gates are configured, reading from `quality-gate.json`.

content.thinking:
The official Allure action is `allure-framework/allure-report@v0`. Let me update the CI workflow to use this instead. The key differences:

1. Uses `allure-framework/allure-report@v0` instead of `simple-elf/allure-report-action`
2. It expects the report to already be generated, or we use `npx allure run` to generate it
3. Just needs `report-directory` and `github-token`

But wait - the official action seems to expect you use `npx allure run -- <test command>` to both run tests and generate the report. 

I need to figure out how to integrate this with our existing `make test-e2e` command that uses `uv run pytest`. The simplest approach would be to install Allure via npm and generate the report separately after tests run, then point the action at that generated report directory.

name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:

permissions:
  pull-requests: write
  checks: write
  contents: read

jobs:
  lint:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make lint
      - run: make format-check

  analysis:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make complexity
      - run: make cpd
      - run: make pylint

  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make test

  test-e2e:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: "20"
      - run: make install
      - run: make test-e2e
      - name: Generate and publish Allure report
        if: always()
        uses: allure-framework/allure-report@v0
        with:
          report-directory: allure-report
          github-token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}

toolUseResult.originalFile:
name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:

jobs:
  lint:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make lint
      - run: make format-check

  analysis:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make complexity
      - run: make cpd
      - run: make pylint

  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make test

  test-e2e:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make test-e2e
      - uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        if: always()
        with:
          name: allure-results
          path: allure-results
          retention-days: 5

  allure-report:
    if: always()
    needs: [test-e2e]
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      contents: write
      actions: read
      checks: write
      pull-requests: write
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: allure-results
          path: allure-results
        continue-on-error: true

      - name: Get Allure history from gh-pages
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
        if: always()
        continue-on-error: true
        with:
          ref: gh-pages
          path: gh-pages

      - name: Copy Allure history
        run: |
          mkdir -p allure-results/history
          cp -r gh-pages/history/* allure-results/history/ 2>/dev/null || true

      - name: Install Allure CLI
        run: |
          curl -sL https://github.com/allure-framework/allure2/releases/download/2.32.0/allure-2.32.0.tgz | tar xz
          echo "$PWD/allure-2.32.0/bin" >> $GITHUB_PATH

      - name: Generate Allure report
        if: always()
        run: allure generate allure-results -o allure-report --clean

      - name: Publish Allure report to GitHub Pages
        if: always() && github.ref == 'refs/heads/main'
        uses: peaceiris/actions-gh-pages@v4
        with:
          github_token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
          publish_branch: gh-pages
          publish_dir: allure-report
          keep_files: false

      - name: Post Allure report summary on PR
        if: always() && github.event_name == 'pull_request'
        uses: actions/github-script@v7
        with:
          script: |
            const fs = require('fs');

            let total = 0, passed = 0, failed = 0, broken = 0;
            const resultsDir = 'allure-results';
            if (fs.existsSync(resultsDir)) {
              const files = fs.readdirSync(resultsDir).filter(f => f.endsWith('-result.json'));
              for (const file of files) {
                try {
                  const data = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(`${resultsDir}/${file}`, 'utf8'));
                  total++;
                  if (data.status === 'passed') passed++;
                  else if (data.status === 'failed') failed++;
                  else if (data.status === 'broken') broken++;
                } catch (e) {}
              }
            }

            const status = failed + broken > 0 ? '❌' : '✅';
            const body = [
              `## ${status} Allure Test Report`,
              '',
              `| Total | Passed | Failed | Broken |`,
              `|-------|--------|--------|--------|`,
              `| ${total} | ${passed} | ${failed} | ${broken} |`,
              '',
              `> Full report is published to GitHub Pages on merge to main.`,
            ].join('\n');

            const { data: comments } = await github.rest.issues.listComments({
              owner: context.repo.owner,
              repo: context.repo.repo,
              issue_number: context.issue.number,
            });
            const existing = comments.find(c =>
              c.user.type === 'Bot' && c.body.includes('Allure Test Report')
            );

            if (existing) {
              await github.rest.issues.updateComment({
                owner: context.repo.owner,
                repo: context.repo.repo,
                comment_id: existing.id,
                body,
              });
            } else {
              await github.rest.issues.createComment({
                owner: context.repo.owner,
                repo: context.repo.repo,
                issue_number: context.issue.number,
                body,
              });
            }

message.content:
This session is being continued from a previous conversation that ran out of context. The summary below covers the earlier portion of the conversation.

Analysis:
Let me chronologically analyze the conversation:

1. **Initial Request**: User wants to implement a plan to move step definitions from `steps/` directories back into `conftest.py` files for 20 E2E services, delete steps/ directories, update architecture tests, and update documentation.

2. **Exploration Phase**: I read multiple files to understand the patterns:
   - `tests/e2e/dynamodb/conftest.py` - had the globals() hack boilerplate
   - `tests/e2e/dynamodb/steps/__init__.py` - had runner, app, and imports
   - Various step files to understand import patterns
   - `tests/e2e/lambda_/conftest.py` - had special Docker checks, constants, fixtures (178 lines)
   - `tests/e2e/sns/conftest.py` and `steps/__init__.py` - had helper functions and shared dicts
   - `tests/e2e/stepfunctions/conftest.py` and `steps/__init__.py` - had constants (PASS_DEFINITION, etc.)
   - `tests/e2e/conftest.py` - parent conftest with session fixtures
   - `tests/architecture/tests/e2e/test_bdd_pattern.py` - architecture tests to modify
   - `tests/architecture/tests/test_file_naming.py` - had steps/ exemption
   - `contributing/testing/END_TO_END.md` - documentation to update

3. **Migration Script**: I wrote `/tmp/migrate_steps.py` to automate the migration. First version missed `import json` needed by many step files. Fixed by adding `get_step_imports()` function to scan each step file for non-standard imports.

4. **Manual Fixes After Script**:
   - lambda_ conftest was missing `import subprocess` and `import pytest` (script only extracted imports from init, not from the original conftest's top-level imports)
   - stepfunctions conftest had `import json # noqa: E402` after runner line instead of at top

5. **Deleted all 20 steps/ directories**

6. **Updated architecture tests**: Removed 4 tests from test_bdd_pattern.py, removed steps/ exemption from test_file_naming.py

7. **Updated END_TO_END.md**: Simplified to show conftest.py pattern without steps/

8. **Verification**: make check (2240 passed), make test-e2e (226 passed)

9. **User requested Allure Report integration** mid-task

10. **Allure Integration - First attempt**: Added `allure-pytest-bdd` dependency, Makefile targets, .gitignore entries. Verified 227 allure result files generated.

11. **User clarified**: "I want all pytest results to use allure-report. I want a github action so I can see the report on a PR"

12. **Added allure-pytest too**: Both `allure-pytest` and `allure-pytest-bdd` conflict on `--alluredir` option. Got ValueError.

13. **User said**: "if I have to choose I will only only have bdd tests" - meaning only allure-pytest-bdd for e2e tests

14. **Simplified**: Only `allure-pytest-bdd`, only e2e tests get allure. Updated Makefile, pyproject.toml, CI workflow.

15. **PR Creation**: Created branch `merge-steps-into-conftest-allure`, squash merged all changes, pushed, created PR #12.

16. **CI Results - First run**: lint, analysis, test, test-e2e all passed. allure-report job failed because `simple-elf/allure-report-action@v1.12` uses deprecated `openjdk:8-jre-alpine` Docker image.

17. **First fix**: Replaced with direct Allure CLI installation. Pushed fix.

18. **User intervention**: "should you be following this guide: https://allurereport.org/docs/integrations-github-action/"

19. **Updated to official action**: Changed to `allure-framework/allure-report@v0`. But this action doesn't exist - the actual repo is `allure-framework/allure-action`.

20. **CI Results - Second run**: test-e2e failed in 2s because `allure-framework/allure-report` repository not found. The correct action name should be `allure-framework/allure-action@v0` based on the search results.

21. **User then requested a summary** (this message).

Key files modified:
- 20 `tests/e2e/*/conftest.py` files
- 20 `tests/e2e/*/steps/` directories deleted
- `tests/architecture/tests/e2e/test_bdd_pattern.py`
- `tests/architecture/tests/test_file_naming.py`
- `contributing/testing/END_TO_END.md`
- `pyproject.toml`
- `Makefile`
- `.gitignore`
- `.github/workflows/ci.yml`
- `uv.lock`

Current state: PR #12 is open. The last push used wrong action name `allure-framework/allure-report@v0` which should be `allure-framework/allure-action@v0`. The test-e2e job failed because of this. Need to fix the action name and push again.

Summary:
1. Primary Request and Intent:
   - **Main task**: Implement a plan to move pytest-bdd step definitions from `steps/` directories back into `conftest.py` files for all 20 E2E services under `tests/e2e/`. Remove the `globals()` hack pattern that was injecting step fixtures.
   - **Secondary task**: Add Allure Report support for BDD e2e tests only (user explicitly chose BDD-only when told about the allure-pytest vs allure-pytest-bdd conflict).
   - **Tertiary task**: Create a GitHub Action to generate Allure reports visible on PRs, following the official guide at https://allurereport.org/docs/integrations-github-action/
   - **Final task**: Raise a PR, wait for CI to pass, fix any failures, then merge and create a release.

2. Key Technical Concepts:
   - pytest-bdd with Gherkin feature files (Given/When/Then)
   - `conftest.py` as the location for step definitions (replacing one-file-per-step in `steps/` directories)
   - `typer.testing.CliRunner` for CLI testing
   - `allure-pytest-bdd` for Allure reporting of BDD tests (NOT `allure-pytest` which conflicts)
   - The `globals()` hack pattern for injecting pytest-bdd step fixtures (being removed)
   - `lws_invoke` fixture for Given steps, `runner.invoke(app, ...)` for When steps, `assert_invoke` for Then steps
   - GitHub Actions workflow with `allure-framework/allure-action@v0` (the correct action name per search results, NOT `allure-framework/allure-report@v0`)

3. Files and Code Sections:

   - **`tests/e2e/*/conftest.py` (all 20 services)** — These are the main files being modified. Each now contains step definitions directly instead of the globals() hack. Example pattern (glacier, simplest case):
     ```python
     """Shared fixtures for glacier E2E tests."""

     from __future__ import annotations

     from pytest_bdd import given, parsers, then, when
     from typer.testing import CliRunner

     from lws.cli.lws import app

     runner = CliRunner()

     # ── Step definitions ──────────────────────────────────────────────────

     @given(
         parsers.parse('a vault "{vault_name}" was created'),
         target_fixture="given_vault",
     )
     def a_vault_was_created(vault_name, lws_invoke, e2e_port):
         ...
     ```

   - **`tests/e2e/lambda_/conftest.py`** — Special case: retains Docker checks, handler constants, and fixtures alongside step definitions. Required manual fix to add `import subprocess` and `import pytest`.

   - **`tests/e2e/sns/conftest.py`** — Special case: contains `_extract_topic_arn`, `_extract_subscription_arn` helpers and `_topic_arns`/`_subscription_arns` dicts directly in conftest.

   - **`tests/e2e/stepfunctions/conftest.py`** — Special case: contains `PASS_DEFINITION`, `UPDATED_DEFINITION`, `ROLE_ARN` constants. Required manual fix to move `import json` to proper position at top.

   - **`tests/architecture/tests/e2e/test_bdd_pattern.py`** — Removed 4 tests: `test_every_service_has_steps_directory`, `test_no_step_decorators_in_service_conftest`, `test_conftest_injects_step_fixtures`, `test_every_step_file_is_explicitly_imported`. Kept 3 tests.

   - **`tests/architecture/tests/test_file_naming.py`** — Removed the `if "steps" in path.parts: continue` exemption.

   - **`contributing/testing/END_TO_END.md`** — Rewritten to document the simpler conftest.py pattern. Removed all `steps/` directory references, `steps/__init__.py` pattern, and `pytest_configure`/fixture injection docs.

   - **`pyproject.toml`** — Added `allure-pytest-bdd>=2.13.0` to both `[dependency-groups] dev` and `[project.optional-dependencies] dev`. No `allure-pytest` (conflicts).

   - **`Makefile`** — Updated `test-e2e` target to include `--alluredir=allure-results`. Added `allure-report` target. Added `.PHONY` entry.
     ```makefile
     test-e2e: ## Run e2e tests (no Docker required)
     	uv run pytest tests/e2e/ -v --alluredir=allure-results

     allure-report: ## Generate and open Allure HTML report (requires allure CLI)
     	allure generate allure-results -o allure-report --clean
     	allure open allure-report
     ```

   - **`.gitignore`** — Added `allure-results` and `allure-report`.

   - **`.github/workflows/ci.yml`** — The CURRENT (broken) version that needs fixing:
     ```yaml
     name: CI

     on:
       push:
         branches: [main]
       pull_request:

     permissions:
       pull-requests: write
       checks: write
       contents: read

     jobs:
       lint:
         runs-on: ubuntu-latest
         steps:
           - uses: actions/checkout@v4
           - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
           - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
             with:
               python-version: "3.11"
           - run: make install
           - run: make lint
           - run: make format-check

       analysis:
         runs-on: ubuntu-latest
         steps:
           - uses: actions/checkout@v4
           - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
           - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
             with:
               python-version: "3.11"
           - run: make install
           - run: make complexity
           - run: make cpd
           - run: make pylint

       test:
         runs-on: ubuntu-latest
         steps:
           - uses: actions/checkout@v4
           - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
           - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
             with:
               python-version: "3.11"
           - run: make install
           - run: make test

       test-e2e:
         runs-on: ubuntu-latest
         steps:
           - uses: actions/checkout@v4
           - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
           - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
             with:
               python-version: "3.11"
           - uses: actions/setup-node@v4
             with:
               node-version: "20"
           - run: make install
           - run: make test-e2e
           - name: Generate and publish Allure report
             if: always()
             uses: allure-framework/allure-report@v0  # WRONG - should be allure-framework/allure-action@v0
             with:
               report-directory: allure-report
               github-token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
     ```

   - **`/tmp/migrate_steps.py`** — Migration script that automated merging steps into conftest.py for all 20 services. Key functions: `extract_step_code()`, `get_step_imports()`, `get_bdd_names()`, `get_init_extras()`, `get_lambda_extras()`.

4. Errors and Fixes:
   - **Missing `import json` in generated conftest files**: First version of migration script only collected imports from `steps/__init__.py`, not from individual step files. Fixed by adding `get_step_imports()` function.
   - **Missing `import subprocess` and `import pytest` in lambda_ conftest**: The `get_lambda_extras()` function only extracted code after the globals() hack, missing imports at the top of the original conftest. Fixed manually with an Edit.
   - **`import json # noqa: E402` misplaced in stepfunctions conftest**: The `import json` from stepfunctions' `__init__.py` was after `runner = CliRunner()`, so it got captured as "extra code" instead of being moved to imports section. Fixed manually with an Edit.
   - **Black formatting issues**: Two files needed reformatting after generation. Fixed with `uvx black`.
   - **allure-pytest + allure-pytest-bdd conflict**: Both register `--alluredir` option, causing `ValueError: option names {'--alluredir'} already added`. User chose BDD-only: "if I have to choose I will only only have bdd tests". Fixed by removing `allure-pytest`, keeping only `allure-pytest-bdd`.
   - **`simple-elf/allure-report-action@v1.12` broken**: Uses deprecated `openjdk:8-jre-alpine` Docker image that no longer exists. Fixed by switching to direct CLI install, then to official action.
   - **User redirect**: User asked "should you be following this guide: https://allurereport.org/docs/integrations-github-action/" — I switched to the official approach.
   - **Wrong action name `allure-framework/allure-report@v0`**: Repository not found. Web search revealed the correct repo is `allure-framework/allure-action` (NOT `allure-framework/allure-report`). This is the CURRENT unresolved error.

5. Problem Solving:
   - Successfully migrated all 20 services from steps/ pattern to conftest.py pattern using automated script + manual fixes
   - Local verification passed: `make check` (2240 passed), `make test-e2e` (226 passed, 227 allure results)
   - PR #12 created and pushed. lint, analysis, test, test-e2e all pass in CI. The allure-report job is what keeps failing.
   - **Ongoing**: The CI `test-e2e` job fails because the allure action name is wrong. Need to change `allure-framework/allure-report@v0` to `allure-framework/allure-action@v0`.

6. All User Messages:

file.content:
name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:

permissions:
  pull-requests: write
  checks: write
  contents: read

jobs:
  lint:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make lint
      - run: make format-check

  analysis:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make complexity
      - run: make cpd
      - run: make pylint

  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make test

  test-e2e:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: "20"
      - run: make install
      - run: make test-e2e
      - name: Generate and publish Allure report
        if: always()
        uses: allure-framework/allure-report@v0
        with:
          report-directory: allure-report
          github-token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}

input.prompt: What is the exact GitHub Action name/repository to use? Show me the exact usage example with the action name and version tag.

content.content:
# Allure GitHub Action Name and Usage

Based on the documentation, the exact GitHub Action to use is:

**Action Name:** `allure-framework/allure-report`
**Version Tag:** `@v0`

## Usage Example

```yaml
- name: Run Allure Action
  uses: allure-framework/allure-report@v0
  with:
    report-directory: "./allure-report"
    github-token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
```

The documentation states: "Add the action to your workflow right after the step at which you produce the Allure Report" and specifies this exact syntax for implementation in your CI/CD pipeline.

content.thinking:
I see - the `permissions` block was actually added by me (it wasn't in the original `ci.yml` on main). Looking at the diff, the original file on main had a much more complex allure setup with a separate `allure-report` job that had its own `permissions` block with `contents: read`, `actions: read`, `checks: write`, `pull-requests: write`.

Now I've moved to a simpler inline action, but the top-level permissions block I added only has `contents: read`. The `allure-framework/allure-action` repo exists (confirmed), but the action name in the docs is `allure-framework/allure-report@v0` which returns 404.
 
There's a mismatch between what the allure docs recommend and what actually exists - the docs say to use `allure-framework/allure-report@v0` but that repo doesn't exist, while `allure-framework/allure-action` is the real one. I should check the action.yml in the actual repo to see what permissions it needs, since my current top-level block might be missing something the allure action requires.

content.text:
Yes, I added the top-level `permissions` block. The original `ci.yml` on `main` didn't have one at the top level — it had permissions only on the separate `allure-report` job. The `allure-framework/allure-action` (the correct repo — the docs reference `allure-report` but that repo doesn't exist) likely needs `contents: write` too for publishing the report.

Let me check what the action actually requires and fix both the action name and permissions.

content.content:
name: "Allure Report Official"
description: "Bring seamless Allure Report 3 integration to your GitHub pipelines"
author: "Allure Team"
branding:
  icon: "check-circle"
  color: "green"

inputs:
  report-directory:
    description: "The report directory to scan for files"
    required: false
    default: "./allure-report"
  github-token:
    description: "GitHub token for creating comments"
    required: false
    default: "${{ github.token }}"

runs:
  using: "node20"
  main: "dist/index.js"

content.text: Good — the action takes `report-directory` and `github-token`. Let me check its README for required permissions.

content.content: # Allure Action > GitHub action to render Allure Report summary right in your Pull Requests [](https://allurereport.org "Allure Report") - Learn more about Allure Report at https://allurereport.org - 📚 [Documentation](https://allurereport.org/docs/) – discover official documentation for Allure Report - ❓ [Questions and Support](https://github.com/orgs/allure-framework/discussions/categories/questions-support) – get help from the team and community - 📢 [Official annoucements](https://github.com/orgs/allure-framework/discussions/categories/announcements) – be in touch with the latest updates - 💬 [General Discussion ](https://github.com/orgs/allure-framework/discussions/categories/general-discussion) – engage in casual conversations, share insights and ideas with the community --- ## Overview This actions scans given report directory for data and posts a summary comment that includes: - Summary statistics about all test results - New, flaky and retry tests - Adds remote report link if the report has been published to the Allure Service ## Usage Add `pull-requests` and `checks` permissions to your workflow to make possible posting comments to Pull Requests: ```yaml permissions: pull-requests: write checks: write ``` Then, add the action to your workflow right after your tests, which produce Allure Report: ```yaml - name: Run tests run |- # run your tests that generate Allure Report data - name: Run Allure Action uses: allure-framework/allure-report@v0 with: # Path to the generated report directory # By default, it's set to `./allure-report` report-directory: "./" # Github Token that uses for posting the comments in Pull Requests github-token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }} ``` If everything is set up correctly and required reports data is present, the Action will post a comment with Allure Report summary to your Pull Request, like this: ## Configuration The action utilizes Allure 3 Runtime configuration file (`allurerc.js` or `allurerc.mjs`) and use `output` field as a path, where it should search for the generated reports. ### Remote reports If you want to be able to open remote reports automatically hosted on Allure Service, provide `allureService` configuration to the `allurerc.js` configuration file: ```diff import { defineConfig } from "allure"; import { env } from "node:process"; export default defineConfig({ output: "allure-report", + allureService: { + url: env.ALLURE_SERVICE_URL, + project: env.ALLURE_SERVICE_PROJECT, + accessToken: env.ALLURE_SERVICE_ACCESS_TOKEN, + } }); ```

Summary statistics about all test results - New, flaky and retry tests - Adds remote report link if the report has been published to the Allure Service ## Usage Add `pull-requests` and `checks` permissions to your workflow to make possible posting comments to Pull Requests: ```yaml permissions: pull-requests: write checks: write ``` Then, add the action to your workflow right after your tests, which produce Allure Report: ```yaml - name: Run tests run |- # run your tests that generate Allure Report data - name: Run Allure Action uses: allure-framework/allure-report@v0 with: # Path to the generated report directory # By default, it's set to `./allure-report` report-directory: "./" # Github Token that uses for posting the comments in Pull Requests github-token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }} ``` If everything is set up correctly and required reports data is present, the Action will post a comment with Allure Report summary to your Pull Request, like this: ## Configuration The action utilizes Allure 3 Runtime configuration file (`allurerc.js` or `allurerc.mjs`) and use `output` field as a path, where it should search for the generated reports. ### Remote reports If you want to be able to open remote reports automatically hosted on Allure Service, provide `allureService` configuration to the `allurerc.js` configuration file: ```diff import { defineConfig } from "allure"; import { env } from "node:process"; export default defineConfig({ output: "allure-report", + allureService: { + url: env.ALLURE_SERVICE_URL, + project: env.ALLURE_SERVICE_PROJECT, + accessToken: env.ALLURE_SERVICE_ACCESS_TOKEN, + } }); ```

Wait, that's strange. The repo is `allure-framework/allure-action` but the README says `uses: allure-framework/allure-report@v0`. So maybe `allure-framework/allure-report` is supposed to work but it's just not a public repo? Or maybe it's published to the GitHub Marketplace under a different name?

Actually, looking at GitHub Actions more carefully - the `uses` field can reference a package published to the GitHub Marketplace, not just a repo. 

But the README's own example uses `allure-framework/allure-report@v0`, which is confusing since that repo doesn't exist - the CI error confirms GitHub can't find it. So either the action is published under a different name in the marketplace, or I should try using the actual repo name `allure-framework/allure-action@v0` instead.

Let me check what tags and releases are available on the `allure-action` repo to see what versions I can actually use.

name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:

permissions:
  pull-requests: write
  checks: write
  contents: read

jobs:
  lint:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make lint
      - run: make format-check

  analysis:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make complexity
      - run: make cpd
      - run: make pylint

  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make test

  test-e2e:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: "20"
      - run: make install
      - run: make test-e2e
      - name: Generate and publish Allure report
        if: always()
        uses: allure-framework/allure-report@v0
        with:
          report-directory: allure-report
          github-token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}

name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:

permissions:
  pull-requests: write
  checks: write
  contents: read

jobs:
  lint:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make lint
      - run: make format-check

  analysis:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make complexity
      - run: make cpd
      - run: make pylint

  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - run: make install
      - run: make test

  test-e2e:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: astral-sh/setup-uv@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: "3.11"
      - uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: "20"
      - run: make install
      - run: make test-e2e
      - name: Generate and publish Allure report
        if: always()
        uses: allure-framework/allure-action@v0
        with:
          report-directory: allure-report
          github-token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}

content.thinking:
The `report-directory` is set to `allure-report` but the test results are generated in `allure-results` by `--alluredir=allure-results`. The action's README says it uses `output` from `allurerc.js` config, and by default it's `./allure-report`. But the action scans for "report data" — I think the Allure action might need the allure-results directory, not a generated report. Let me check by looking at the action's README more carefully.

From the README: "This actions scans given report directory for data and posts a summary comment." And the input says "Path to the generated report directory". 

The default is `./allure-report`, but we're generating `allure-results` with pytest instead. The `allure-report` directory is what you get after running `allure generate allure-results -o allure-report`. I'm not sure if the Allure action generates the report itself or expects it to be pre-generated, so I need to look at the allurerc.js configuration to understand what the action actually needs.

Looking at the config, `output` is set to `allure-report`, but `allure-pytest-bdd` generates results in `allure-results` format. The real question is whether we need to change the `report-directory` to `allure-results`, run `allure generate` first, or if the action is smart enough to handle both. I think the best approach is to just commit the action name fix and see if it works—if the action fails, the error will tell us what we need to adjust.

content.text:
The action's README says `report-directory` defaults to `./allure-report`. But our tests generate data in `allure-results` (via `--alluredir=allure-results`). Let me check if we should point it to `allure-results` instead, or if the action expects a generated report.

Looking at the action README again — it says it "scans given report directory for data". Since `allure-pytest-bdd` outputs results to `allure-results`, I should point the action there. Let me update that too.

## What's Changed

### E2E Test Architecture Simplification
- **Moved all step definitions back into `conftest.py`** — removed the `steps/` directory pattern and `globals()` hack across all 20 E2E service test suites
- Simpler, IDE-friendly pattern: step definitions live alongside fixtures in each service's `conftest.py`
- Updated architecture tests to enforce the new pattern
- Updated contributing documentation

### Allure Report Integration
- Added `allure-pytest-bdd` for BDD test reporting
- E2E test results are now published as Allure reports on pull requests via `allure-framework/allure-action`
- Added `make allure-report` target for local report generation

### Testing
- All 2,240 unit/integration tests passing
- All 226 E2E BDD tests passing
EOF
)"

content.text:
Done. Here's a summary of everything completed:

1. **PR #12 merged** — Migrated all 20 E2E services from `steps/` directories back into `conftest.py`, removed the `globals()` hack pattern
2. **Allure reporting added** — `allure-framework/allure-action@v0` posts test summaries on PRs
3. **All CI checks passed** — lint, analysis, test (2,240), test-e2e (226)
4. **Release v0.9.0 created** — https://github.com/local-web-services/local-web-services/releases/tag/v0.9.0

To answer your original question: yes, the `permissions` block with `pull-requests: write` and `checks: write` was added by me (it wasn't in the original `ci.yml` on main). These are required by the Allure action to post PR comments and check results.

   - S3 (buckets, objects, presigned URLs, notifications)

For each service, list:
- What CLI commands exist
- What E2E test features exist
- What operations appear to be missing compared to typical serverless usage

Focus on identifying **functional gaps** - missing operations that would be needed for a real serverless application workflow. Don't worry about services that are clearly out of scope (like EC2, VPC, etc.).

I need to identify gaps in the serverless implementation of this project. This is a local AWS services emulator (like LocalStack). 

Please thoroughly explore:

1. **CLI commands available** - Look at `src/lws/cli/` to see what services and commands exist
2. **API providers** - Look at `src/lws/api/` or similar to see what API operations are implemented  
3. **E2E test coverage** - Look at `tests/e2e/*/features/*.feature` to see what operations have tests
4. **Common serverless AWS services** - Compare what's implemented against what a typical serverless app needs:
   - Lambda (functions, layers, invoke, event source mappings)
   - API Gateway (REST APIs, routes, integrations, deployments, stages)
   - DynamoDB (CRUD, queries, scans, transactions, GSI/LSI, streams)
   - S3 (buckets, objects, presigned URLs, notifications)
   - SQS (queues, messages, dead letter queues, FIFO)
   - SNS (topics, subscriptions, publish, filters)
   - Step Functions (state machines, executions)
   - EventBridge (event buses, rules, targets, schedules)
   - Cognito (user pools, app clients, auth flows)
   - SSM Parameter Store
   - Secrets Manager
   - CloudWatch Logs / Metrics (if applicable)

For each service, list:
- What CLI commands exist
- What E2E test features exist
- What operations appear to be missing compared to typical serverless usage

Focus on identifying **functional gaps** - missing operations that would be needed for a real serverless application workflow. Don't worry about services that are clearly out of scope (like EC2, VPC, etc.).
